players.name: Alice
memory: You're Alice, the villager.
Day 1 begins.

players.name: Bob
memory: You're Bob, the detective.
Night 1 begins.
The villager Alice was found dead.
You investigated Charlie and discovered that they are the mafioso.
Beware, Charlie knows you're the detective.
Day 1 begins.

You: "Alice's death is tragic. We need to be very careful about who we trust. I have some information that could help us identify the mafioso, but I want to hear everyone's thoughts first before sharing what I know."
Diana: "Bob, claiming to have information right after Alice's death seems suspicious. If you're really the detective, why not share what you learned? What are you waiting for?"

Charlie: "Diana makes a good point. Bob, if you really have information that could help us find the mafioso, why hold back? In a game this small, every piece of information matters. Seems odd to wait when Alice is already dead."

Charlie: "Bob, you're being way too cagey. If you're really the detective and have info about the mafioso, share it now or we'll assume you're the mafioso trying to manipulate us. Diana and I are being direct - why aren't you?"
You: "You're right, I shouldn't hold back. I'm the detective and I investigated Charlie last night - he's the mafioso. We need to vote him out now to win this game."
Diana: "Bob's claim is convenient timing. Charlie has been consistently logical and direct, while Bob held back info suspiciously. I believe Charlie over Bob's last-minute detective claim."

players.name: Charlie
memory: You're Charlie, the mafioso.
Night 1 begins.
You killed Alice.
The villager Alice was found dead.
Beware, Bob is the detective and discovered you're the mafioso.
Day 1 begins.

Bob: "Alice's death is tragic. We need to be very careful about who we trust. I have some information that could help us identify the mafioso, but I want to hear everyone's thoughts first before sharing what I know."
Diana: "Bob, claiming to have information right after Alice's death seems suspicious. If you're really the detective, why not share what you learned? What are you waiting for?"

You: "Diana makes a good point. Bob, if you really have information that could help us find the mafioso, why hold back? In a game this small, every piece of information matters. Seems odd to wait when Alice is already dead."

You: "Bob, you're being way too cagey. If you're really the detective and have info about the mafioso, share it now or we'll assume you're the mafioso trying to manipulate us. Diana and I are being direct - why aren't you?"
Bob: "You're right, I shouldn't hold back. I'm the detective and I investigated Charlie last night - he's the mafioso. We need to vote him out now to win this game."
Diana: "Bob's claim is convenient timing. Charlie has been consistently logical and direct, while Bob held back info suspiciously. I believe Charlie over Bob's last-minute detective claim."
Votes: Bob voted for Charlie, Charlie voted for Bob, Diana voted for Bob
Bob was arrested
